Message.Title: Silver Lake and Microsoft Want This Deal Badly
Message.Msg: http://finance.yahoo.com/blogs/the-exchange/investment-dell-could-signal-microsoft-migration-pc-business-013410086.html Good article from Yahoo blog explains the close and longstanding relations between Dell, Silver Lake and MSFT. Also explains why deal is very important and potentially very profitable for both Silver Lake and MSFT. The 13.50 to 14.25 figure thrown about by media clearly a low ball market tester. This could go as high as 18-20 as Dell shareholders make their voice heard.

Message.Title: No way Deal can be done at 14.
Message.Msg: It has to be at least 18.Dell and MSFT knows this.

Topic.Title: No way Deal can be done at 14.

Message.Msg: I agree, what shareholder that has been holding Dell is going to be happy with $13 or $14. How can M. Dell justify stealing the company away from shareholders at that price when all along he has been claiming its worth MORE. Potential lawsuits will drive the price slightly higher.

Message.Title: Will Dell become the next Apple??
Message.Msg: Remember when Apple collapsed dropping from huge highs and landed at around $10? Everyone thought they were finished. But WOW what a run that stock has had since falling to that ridiculous low. We all know that Michael Dell is a genius and will turn this company around to become the mega star company it was in the 90's. Dell could indeed become th enext apple. In fact it may be happening now as apple is falling like a rock. Where is the new business going? I say -----DELL!!

Topic.Title: DEAL or NO DEAL ???

Message.Msg: This is a pretty big LBO?

Topic.Title: DEAL or NO DEAL ???

Message.Msg: For a deal that requires so much money or equity roll commitments, of an amount speculated to be in the range of $26 billion to $35 billion, it will and can take time. The PE groups and the Founder/ CEO want it as cheaply as possible $15 or so. The institutional investment managers want it to be in the $20's. There are on-going discussions that will lead to a resolution. Be patient! (all the above is IMO!)

Topic.Title: DEAL or NO DEAL ???

Message.Msg: This morning on squawk box,about 8am est. ,Becky Quick indicated : " Hewlett Packard is considering buying Dell and may announce a deal as early as this week ." Now,to be clear,that is what she indicated,verbatum,not my opinion or an inference I have surmised. Is that plausable? It warranted a merit threshold to allow the statment to be broadcast on an internationally accredited investment program. A possible inclusion to a prudent longs equation for profit.Time will tell.
